meanings.definition: Carve or shape (a piece of stone or wood) into a sculpture.
meanings.sent1: She used a chisel to sculp a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to sculp a figure out of marble.
meanings.sent3: The young boy tried to sculp a dinosaur out of playdough.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to sculp his heart with their sharpness.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's hands moved skillfully to sculp the intricate details.

meanings.definition: Create (a sculpture) by carving or shaping stone or wood.
meanings.sent1: He carefully sculped a bird out of a block of wood.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor planned to sculp a masterpiece for the art exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally sculped a cat instead of a dog.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to sculp the air around them into a joyful melody.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor's tools were used to sculp the raw material into a work of art.

meanings.sent3: The young sculp dreamed of one day sculpting famous monuments.

meanings.sent5: Visitors gathered around the sculp to watch the creation process.
